Song.title: Amazing Grace
Song.copyright: Words & Music by John Newton and Thomas Augustine Arne Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: A[G]mazing [G7]grace, how [C]sweet the [G]sound That [G]saved a [G7]wretch like [D]me. I [G]once was [G7]lost, but [C]now I'm [G]found, Was [Em]blind, but [D7]now I [C]see. [G]
Verse 2: 'Twas gr[G]ace that [G7]taught my [C]heart to [G]fear, And [G]grace my [G7]fears re[D]lieved. How [G]precious [G7]did that [C]grace a[G]ppear The [Em]hour I [D7]first be[C]lieved![G]
Verse 3: Through [G]many [G7]dangers, [C]toils and [G]snares I [G]have al[G7]ready [D]come 'Tis [G]grace hath [G7]brought me [C]safe thus [G]far And [Em]grace will [D7]lead me [C]home[G]
Verse 4: When [G]we've been [G7]there ten [C]thousand [G]years Bright [G]shining [G7]as the [D]sun, We've [G]no less [G7]days to [C]sing God's [G]praise Then [Em]when we've [D]first be[C]gun.[G]
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 amazing grace how sweet the sound that saved a wretch like me i once was lost but now im found was blind but now i see verse 2 twas grace that taught my heart to fear and grace my fears relieved how precious did that grace appear the hour i first believed verse 3 through many dangers toils and snares i have already come tis grace hath brought me safe thus far and grace will lead me home verse 4 when weve been there ten thousand years bright shining as the sun weve no less days to sing gods praise then when weve first begun
